H0.text: These mountains were once under the ocean, as indicated by the imprints of ocean clam shells found in the rocks of the Appalachian Mountains.

H1.text: These mountains once had a more rainy climate, as indicated by imprints of ocean clam shells found in the rocks of the Appalachian Mountains.

H2.text: Mountain river clams evolved from ocean clams, as evidenced by the imprint fossils of ocean clam shells that are commonly found in the rocks of the Appalachian Mountains.

H3.text: Ocean clams evolved from mountain river clams, as indicated by the imprints of ocean clam shells that are often found in the rocks of the Appalachian Mountains.

A4.text: Shells and other hard parts of ancient marine plants and animals accumulated to form limey deposits that later became limestone.
